entry.title: How to use composite: SAP_X_XPA_LeftSidePanel in SAC story?
entry.content:
Hello Community,

Can you please let us know about the following?

1. How to use composite: SAP_X_XPA_LeftSidePanel in SAC story? 

2. How to utilize the functionality of the icons(Expand/Collapse, Filter, Comment, Information, Help) given in the left panel?

entry.title: copy data based on the current week of current year to next year in SAC planning
entry.content:
Hello,

I want to write a data action which copy the data into next year based on the current week. Below is an example assuming my current week is 202503:

Retail WeekVersionAmount
202601LY2000
 CY3000
 NY2000
202602LY4000
 CY5000
 NY4000
202603LY6000
 CY7000
 NY7000
202604LY8000
 CY9000
 NY9000
202605LY10000
 CY11000
 NY11000

 

Assuming my current week is 202503, so my requirement is to copy the data from Version LY to NY till 202602 and from Version CY to NY from 202603 onwards.

 

I tried to write below code in SAC data action, but it didn't copy anything in next year, because the range in the scope is not correct. 

Do we have any function which gives me date for next year of current week?

 

MEMBERSET [d/Date] = "2026-01-01" TO PERIOD(TODAY())
DELETE()
DATA()= RESULTLOOKUP([d/Version]="public.LY").
 
Is there anyway to achieve this?
 
Thanks.

entry.title: Visualizaci√≥n de dimensi√≥n en SAP Analytics Cloud
entry.content:
Buen d√≠a estimados colegas.

Solicito de su ayuda para conocer c√≥mo visualizar en SAP Analytics Cloud, solamente la clave principal de una dimensi√≥n que posee una asociaci√≥n en la Vista de Datasphere mediante una llave compuesta. 

En la vista, la dimensi√≥n est√° asociada de esta manera:

 

En el modelo anal√≠tico, la llave compuesta se visualiza de esta manera:

 

Cuando creo una tabla en SAC, agregando la dimensi√≥n directamente desde el repositorio, se visualizan ambas claves

 

 

El √∫nico dato que deseo visualizar es la llave principal de la llave compuesta (C√≥digo), que es la que aparece en el recuadro azul.

Si agrego solo el atributo, me queda siempre la columna principal con ambas llaves y se agrega otra columna con el atributo como deseo visualizarlo.

 

Les agradecer√© mucho su apoyo.

Slds

entry.title: SAC Planning : Cross model copy with hierarchies
entry.content:
Hi All,
I am trying to copy data from Model A to Model B using advanced formula steps.
These 2 models are having different hierarchies at different levels.
Model A hierachy

Model B hierarchy

I am writing data copy step like below

MODEL [Model A]
ENDMODEL
DATA([d/Measures]="Sales_Qty",[d/Product]=[Model A].[d/Product]) = 
LINK([Model A] ,[d/Measures]="SalesQty",[d/Version]="public.Actual" )
If i want to include the hierarchy either from Model A or Model B , how to do it ?
If we have 2 models with different level hierachies how data will get copy from one to another.

Cany anyone of you please clarify this.
Thanks in advance

entry.title: When export table to Excel in SAC , what filters will be shown in Appendix page ?
entry.content:
Hello , 

I am quite confused what filters will be shown in Appendix page when export table to Excel in SAC.
I originally thought it will only show page filters , no calculation input control will be shown , but based on my testing , sometimes calculation input control are also included.

Take below example , company code , profit centre are page filter ,   while Posting Period is calculation input control .  and don't under why "ledger" (page filter) and other calculation input control are also not included in appendix . System based on what condition to control which filters are displayed in Appendix page ?  

Many thanks.

Lee

entry.title: Calculation of YTD Last year in the model - SAP ANALYTICS CLOUD
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I'm trying to calculate last year's YTD in the model, but the standard YTD formula doesn't seem to work because I'm also using the PREVIOUS function in the calculation. As a result, no data appears in the measure. Do you know a formula that can calculate last year's YTD in the model?

entry.title: When using a link model, blank values are replaced with the model ID.
entry.content:
Hello Community,
I want to display two models in a single chart in SAP Analytics Cloud.
To achieve this, I configured linked dimensions in the story and added linked models to the chart.
„Éªmodels

„ÉªLink Dimensions

„ÉªAdd Linked Models


Then I added items to the chart (table) and displayed them.
Item: While blank data exists in CUSTOMER,
displaying a single model in the table shows (No Value).
However, displaying two models in the table causes alphanumeric characters to appear.


Looking at the displayed alphanumeric characters, it appears that one of the model IDs for the model you are using is shown.


Is there a way to display blank values as (No Value) instead of alphanumeric characters like model IDs when adding model links or link models?

If anyone knows how to do this, please let me know.

Thanks best regards.

entry.title: Is there a way to include values from multiple models in an input control?
entry.content:
Hello Community,

In SAP Analytics Cloud stories, when displaying multiple models in a single chart,
there is a requirement to display multiple models within a single input control.

By setting linked dimensions in the story,
you can add linked dimensions to the chart.
However, no similar functionality is found in the input controls.

For example, regarding the two models below, when creating an input control named COMPANYCODE,
we want the company code values TEST and TEST2 to be displayed.
However, since currently only one model can be specified per input control,
this requires two separate input controls‚Äîone displaying only TEST and another displaying only TEST2.


Is there a way to use values from multiple models for a single input control?


If anyone knows how to do this, please let me know.
Thanks best regards.

entry.title: Complex Calculations on Hierarchies from SAP BW to SAC
entry.content:
Hi,

I'm facing a data mismatch issue on parent nodes in an SAC Model imported from BW.

My BW Query uses complex formulas for parent node values. SAC reads the leaf nodes and then uses its internal SUM aggregation for parent nodes, resulting in incorrect totals on the parent hierarchy levels. But The BW formula is too complex to replicate in SAC.

Is there a configuration in SAC or a best practice to force SAC to read and use the pre-calculated, aggregated parent node values directly from the BW Query? Or some configuration in BW?

entry.title: Cannot find an easier way to do conditional aggregation in SAC
entry.content:
Hello,

 I just got started with SAC and I find it very difficult to deal with conditional aggregations. 

Suppose I have a dataset with measure A and B. I want to know the % count of the ratio of A/B > than 100% vs all the records which A/B is not null(B <>0).

 In excel or Tableau this is super easy, In excel it's something just like countif(A/B>100%)/countif(A/B>0) and in Tableau its something like sum(if(A/B>100%,1,0))/sum(if(A/B>0,1,0)).

However in SAC I cannot do aggregation in calculated measure. The aggregation does not allow conditional clauses and restricted measure option only allows setting restrictions on dimensions. For something as simple as this I had to create 5 measures; 2 for adding "boolean columns" like "if A/B >1,1,0 and if A/B>0,1,0" . 2 more measures for aggregation of these 2 measures using the aggregation option of the calculated measure. and then 1 more for the division of these 2 aggregations. This is way too inefficient.

Can someone please tell me what is the best way of doing these type of calculations?

entry.title: Add account to a numeric point chart using script in SAC
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

I am trying to display different measures for a numeric point chart in SAC by selecting different values from a dropdown list using scripting.

However, the numeric point chart is not retrieving data as expected with the script provided‚Äîinstead, it shows the message "More accounts are required to build a numeric point chart."

I have attempted multiple methods to add accounts to the chart via script, but none have successfully passed the account values to the numeric point. For example, I've tried setDimensionFilter, which works perfectly for generic dimension, but fails for the account dimension. In the case of account dimension, it seems to select a newly created account value instead of the existing one from the model.

Does anyone know how I can modify the script below to ensure accounts are properly added to the numeric point chart?

Any hints or suggestions would be greatly appreciated. Thank you in advance.

 

var selectedValue = Dropdown_1.getSelectedKey();

var chart1MeasureMap = {
    "Value1": "sales_CD",
    "Value2": "sales_PD"
};

var chart2MeasureMap = {
    "Value1": "sales_CD", 
    "Value2": "sales_PD"
};

var targetCharts = [Chart_1, Chart_2];
var measureMaps = [chart1MeasureMap, chart2MeasureMap];

for (var j = 0; j < targetCharts.length; j++) {
    var currentChart = targetCharts[j];
    var currentMeasureMap = measureMaps[j];
    var selectedMeasure = currentMeasureMap[selectedValue];
    
    var currentMeasures = currentChart.getMeasures(Feed.ValueAxis) || [];
    for (var i = 0; i < currentMeasures.length; i++) {
        currentChart.removeMeasure(currentMeasures[i], Feed.ValueAxis);
    }
    
    if (selectedMeasure) {
        currentChart.addMeasure(selectedMeasure, Feed.ValueAxis);
    }
}

 SAP Analytics Cloud

entry.title: How to count the number of repeated rows in story table
entry.content:
Hello there! ~

I face issue as below, if someone can help me here.

My original story table contains first 3 columns similar as below table, as there are repeated "category", so I would like to add a new column at last to count the repeated row number for the same "category", as in story table, there is no "count if" formular, and i tried create new measure with "aggregation" count, it still doesn't work.

BTW: I cant have calculation in data model, as this is live data, it doesn't allow me to edit.

Thank you very much for the help, and if I didn't make myself clear, I can explain more on this.

 

CategorySub-categoryamount of sub-categorycount of category
fruits peach23
fruits watermelon33
fruits apples53
booksmagazine12
bookschildren book42
Snackschips34
Snackscandy64
Snacksbread24
Snacksbiscuits14

entry.title: SAC Total/Sum of story calculated measure incorrect
entry.content:
Hi All. 

I have a story calculated measure which references 3 story restricted measures.  Owing for the need to be dynamic according to user Input Control selections, these restricted measures are created in the story - and not the model.

When applying the "Show totals" setting on the dimension in the rows, the calculated measure is not aggregated, but rather the calculation/formula is also applied at the "Total" level.

For example, in the below table at the row level, "Calculated Trend" = Value MTD / Shift MTD x Shift Full Month.

I am wanting the "Calculated Trend" Total to be the sum of the row Calculated Trend values.

Expected behaviour:

But what is happening is the "Calculated Trend" formula is carried over to the "Total" row...

Current behaviour:

I have tried changing the "Intersecting Client Calculation Priority" but no change takes place.

I wanted to create an "Aggregation" calculated measure with the "SUM" exception aggregation type calculated measure are not available for use in Aggregation caclulations.

Any ideas on how to get the Totals row of a calcualted measure to "SUM"?

Rgds

Anton

entry.title: SAC Data Import ‚Äì Automatically email rejected/error rows to specific users?
entry.content:
Hi everyone üòÄ

In SAP Analytics Cloud, is there a built-in way to automatically email the rejected rows that occur during a model data import
(in Data Management), to a specific list of users?

I know about the Rejection Summary (CSV) in the Data Management monitor,
but I‚Äôm looking for an automated email notification with those details right after the import finishes.

Any native feature or recommended workaround (e.g., Calendar/notifications, APIs, Integration Suite/automation)?

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: Filter settings in the SAP Analytics Cloud Calendar
entry.content:
Hello,

I have a question regarding filter settings in the SAP Analytics Cloud Calendar.
I have created a process with multiple general tasks under it. For each general task, I am using filters for fiscal year, approval year, and a unique profit center. Currently, I have manually set the fiscal and approval year to 2024.

Is it possible to have these year filters update automatically as the process recurs in future years (e.g., 2025, 2026, ...)?
Alternatively, does the Calendar allow for dynamic or relative date selection in filters, or is there a way to set up a reminder to update these filters annually?

Thank you in advance for your support!

entry.title: Group reporting + data collection + SAC - SAP Public cloud
entry.content:
Hello experts,

We currently have an SAP FC platform serving 15 clients in a SaaS model. Our objective is to migrate this environment to SAP Group Reporting on the public cloud.

All 15 clients will use the Group Reporting solution.

In SAP FC, we are able to separate data for each client by connecting each client to their own SQL database. However, in Group Reporting, there is only one tenant.

Our question is: Is it possible to achieve data separation using authorizations and roles, so that each client can access only their own data and cannot see others‚Äô data?

Our planned setup will include Group Reporting, Data Collection, and SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC).

Thank you very much for your help

entry.content:

  1. Could someone clarify whether Cloud Foundry data centers (AWS, GCP, Azure, etc.) are available in the UAE region, and whether SAP BTP is hosted on them.
  2. One of our customers is currently using a Neo tenant for SAC. Is it possible to migrate this to Cloud Foundry? If so, would there be any changes to the licensing model or associated costs?

Regards

entry.title: inconsistent results from Resource & Resource_Recent_Access models
entry.content:
Hopefully someone can shed some light on this one,
I'm building a new story using the SAP provided system overview models:
Resource & Resource_Recent_Access

In the screenshot below I've filtered both tables to 
Object Type = Story
Sub Type = No value  (to remove the data insights)
The count is a Dimension count of Object ID

I don't understand why The recent access table is showing few objects?
there's no data filter so it should be a list of all objects regardless of when they were accessed...... and I'd expect every story to have been accessed at least once - even it was just a build time.

entry.title: Copy and paste a cell from SAC to Excel cause numbers desconfiguration
entry.content:
Hello!!

I face some issue, if someone can help me here.

When i copy a row or a cell from SAC and paste at Excel the numbers come desconfigured. For example: the number on the dashboard is 242,487.176. When i paste at Excel is 242487176. Is there something i can do to prevent this situation?

entry.title: Why can other users not see the ‚ÄúInstall‚Äù button for my published Data Product in SAP Datasphere?
entry.content:
I have created a Data Product in SAP Datasphere and published it successfully. I can find it in the Marketplace, and other users can also see it listed. However, they do not see the blue Install button, even though they have the same roles and permissions as I do.

My Data Product looks like this when I open it from the Marketplace (see Image 1). As you can see, the Install button is missing.
The Install button normally looks like in Image 2, depending on the settings of the Data Provider.

What could be the reason for this? Are there additional steps required to make the Data Product installable for other users in the same Datasphere tenant?

Any guidance or best practices would be appreciated.
